intro: Chamaeanthus robertsii, commonly known as Roberts' rockrose, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its compact growth habit makes it suitable for rock gardens or as a container plant. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
